intro: Potentilla laciniosa var. hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It is a perennial shrub characterized by its hairy stems and leaves with five lobes, giving it the common name. The plant produces clusters of small, yellow, five-petaled flowers that bloom in early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or alpine environments. Its botanical features make it a notable species in horticulture and ecological studies.
